results.title: Basic training and conditioning: weight training. No. 2
results.creator_credit: Ryan Films and Dr Frank Ryan
results.brief_description: Shows the role played by muscles in various athletic events and illustrates the different exercises necessary for muscle development. A brief examination of the fibres of the muscles is given explaining how they function and how muscles are strengthened; preliminary conditioning for a young athlete training for shot putting, showing him incorporating and practising a weight training program; and the muscles emphasised in discus throwing, the high jump, and the javelin, and the weight training associated with each.

results.title: Basic training and conditioning: weight training. No. 1
results.creator_credit: Ryan Films and Dr Frank Ryan
results.brief_description: Expresses the opinion that much of the athletic achievement in recent years has been due to weight training and indicates the events associated with weight training or weight lifting. The part played by the various muscles in these events are pointed out, and the training program for developing these muscles illustrated and described.

results.title: Basic stairbuilding
results.brief_description: Master carpenter Scott Schuttner will instruct you on how to build solid and attractive stairs by assembling two common staircases: a straight run stair and an L-shaped stair. You will also discover how a professional troubleshoots and corrects problems, how to calculate and mark the rise and run for any length stair, anchor posts and handrails and fasten treads and risers. During the action, the camera takes you where your eyes want to be.

results.title: Basic skills of women's basketball
results.brief_description: This films uses slow motion and still photography to demonstrate the necessary skills required for women’s basketball. Skills dealt with include passing, catching, dodging, foot work, goal shooting and intercepting. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic shots
results.brief_description: Defines and illustrates the range of film shots from very long to very close as used in television production. Discusses basic composition rules for one person, several, groups and crowds. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic Sewing Skills for Stretch Knits
results.brief_description: Hosted by Paula Duncan, this Woman’s Day program will provide you with all of the necessary basic information on stretch knit sewing. Armed with the basics you will then be able to make garments ranging from loose fitting T-shirts to after-five frocks.

results.title: Basic reproduction processes in the graphic arts
results.brief_description: Explains briefly the four basic printing processes - letterpress, gravure, lithography and silk screen. The general principles are demonstrated as well as the means of preparing images for printing including the linotype and monotype machines, and mechanical and chemical photocopying equipment. Various types of printing presses are shown and reference is made to flexography for the printing of flexible packaging. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic parts and threading of the sewing machine
results.brief_description: Illustrates the construction and operation of a Singer 404 sewing machine. Demonstrates the filling of the bobbin and threading of the machine. Close up photography is used to show the position and use of the various parts. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic movie making
results.brief_description: Explains the techniques for camera steadiness, zooming and panning, as well as ways in which to make movies visually interesting. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic metalwork: soft soldering. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: An explanation of the fundamentals of soldering. Looks at joints relying on capillary action, preparation of ‘killed spirits’, the prevention of corrosion and the use of resin flux. No other credits available.
